title: Smoother
text:
Smoother(self, method='dct_smooth', **kwargs)
A smoother function factory











Name
Type
Description
Default




method
Union[str, Callable]
The smoothing method to use. Defaults to “dct_smooth”. Can be a custom smoother such that it takes a 1D array as input and returns a Smoothed class.
'dct_smooth'


kwargs

Any additional arguments or parameters for the method.
{}









Name
Description




smooth
Apply the smoother function to the data

Apply the smoother function to the data

Type

Default




x
np.array
a 1D numpy array
required

Description

Type

float
The max formant

np.array
The time domain of the formant estimates

np.ndarray
A (formants, time) array of values. The formants as initially estimated by praat-parselmouth


n_measured_formants
int
The total number of formants for which formant tracks were estimatable


imputed_formants
np.ndarray
Formant tracks for which missing values were imputed using sklearn.impute.IterativeImputer


smoothed_formants
np.ndarray
The smoothed formant values, using the method passed to smoother.


smooth_error
float
The error term between imputed formants and smoothed formants.

title: About
text: About this site

title: Getting Started
text:
Install fasttrackpy
! pip install fasttrackpy
Run fasttrack

! fasttrack --help

Usage: fasttrack [OPTIONS]

  Run fasttrack

Inputs: [at least 1 required]
  Input file options
  --file PATH                     A single input audio file to process.
  --dir PATH                      A directory of input audio files to process.

Output Destinations: [at least 1 required]
  Output destination options
  --output PATH                   Name of an output file
  --dest PATH                     Name of an output directory

Output Options:
  Options for what data should be saved.
  --which-output [winner|all]     Whether to save just the winner, or all
                                  candidates. Defaults to 'winner'
  --data-output [formants|param]  Whether to save the formant data, or
                                  smoothing parameter data. Defaults to
                                  'formants'.

Audio processing:
  --xmin FLOAT RANGE              Start time for beginning analysis. Defaults
                                  to 0(s). (Ignored for multi-file input.)
                                  [x>=0]
  --xmax FLOAT RANGE              End time for analysis. If not set, defaults
                                  to full duration. (Ignored for multi-file
                                  input.)  [x>0]
  --min-max-formant FLOAT RANGE   Start of possible max-formant range. Defaults
                                  to 4000(Hz).  [x>0]
  --max-max-formant FLOAT RANGE   End of possible max-formant range. Defaults
                                  to 7000(Hz).  [x>0]
  --nstep INTEGER RANGE           Number of max-formant steps to be evaluated.
                                  Defaults to 20.  [x>=1]
  --n-formants INTEGER RANGE      Number of formants to track. Defaults to 4.
                                  [x>=1]
  --window-length FLOAT RANGE     Formant analysis window length. Defaults to
                                  0.05(s).  [x>0]
  --time-step FLOAT RANGE         Formant analysis window step size. Defaults
                                  to 0.002(s).  [x>0]
  --pre-emphasis-from FLOAT RANGE
                                  Pre-emphasis. Defaults to 50(Hz).  [x>=0]

Smoother options:
  --smoother-method [dct_smooth|dct_smooth_regression]
                                  Smoother method to use. Defaults to
                                  'dct_smooth' (Discrete Cosine Transform)
  --smoother-order INTEGER RANGE  Order of the smooth. Defaults to 5. (More is
                                  wigglier.)  [x>=1]
  --loss-method [lmse|mse]        The loss function comparing formants to
                                  smoothed tracks. Defaults to lmse (log mean
                                  squared error).

Other options:
  --help                          Show this message and exit.

text: These are the docs for fasttrackpy

CandidateTracks(self, sound, min_max_formant=4000, max_max_formant=7000, nstep=20, n_formants=4, window_length=0.05, time_step=0.002, pre_emphasis_from=50, smoother=Smoother(), loss_fun=Loss(), agg_fun=Agg())
A class for candidate tracks for a single formant
This takes the same arguments as OneTrack except for `max_formant.











Name
Type
Description
Default

float
The floor for the max_formant setting. Defaults to 4000.
4000

float
The cieling for the max_formant setting. Defaults to 7000.
7000

int
The number of steps for the grid search. Defaults to 20.
20














Name
Type
Description




candidates
list[OneTrack, …]
A list of OneTrack tracks.

int
The smallest number of successfully measured formants across all candidates


smooth_errors
np.array
The error terms for each treack in candidates


winner_idx
int
The candidate track with the smallest error term


winner
OneTrack
The winning OneTrack track,
